column4: does anyone know what the laws on archiving dvd movies is?  I own a small video store and would like to dup the orginals and rent out the backups so that when they get scratched i can destroy them and create new ones.  My customers would love this but aparently this is not legal?
better to ask forgiveness than permission, just do it until someone sends you a letter
fair use is always debatable, this is why we have lawyers and lobbiests
if someone has a problem they will send you a cease and desist, and unless you are selling copies you'll have no problems beyond civil
im thinking companys like redbox must use a lisc schema like this.
you're exploring fair use, fair use is always debatable
if you're so worried maybe buy insurance instead of paying for backups?
and then call the EFF, and then call the MPAA
this is why they have intellectual property attorneys :)
everyone will, building a business is about risk vs reward *shrugs*
exactly
you have plausible deniability
you are clearly not trying to infiringe
keep in mind the cost of blanks + labor, ususally just mailing in dead ones for copies is better, as per blockbuster
ya i dont know that i can mail these in.  Besides i much like the lightscribe look to the disks..otherwise we have to perm-marker our name onto the disks..sometimes its not easy to do.
sounds good to me man, i dont think anyone will care, the big thing these days is streaming

the other thing is..(and this is  a bit grey area of course,) is that i could see us buying 5 copies of something and it turning out to be that we need 10...ok we run off 10 for the night and pick up 5 more in the morning.)  If i was to get audited that morning i would be screwed..but i just cant see anyone being that anal about that sort of stuff.
that would be illegal definitely, you could argue it like anything else but i think you'd ahve to pay someone
better off just telling them to come back later
ya i agree. its just i can see that sort of thing happening.
well, then buy 10 up front :)
yea
